meanings.definition: Characterized by unruly or disorderly behavior.
meanings.sent1: The rowdier students were running around the playground.
meanings.sent2: The party became rowdier as the night went on.
meanings.sent3: The rowdier group of puppies kept knocking over the water bowl.
meanings.sent4: The rowdier wind made the trees sway violently.
meanings.sent5: The rowdier crowd at the concert was jumping and shouting with excitement.

meanings.definition: More unruly or disorderly than others.
meanings.sent1: The rowdier kids were causing trouble in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: His behavior became rowdier after he had too much sugar.
meanings.sent3: The rowdier group of birds squawked loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The rowdier traffic made it difficult to cross the street.
meanings.sent5: The rowdier waves crashed against the shore with great force.
